audio_description: Use 1 kg Jeerakasala rice to make this biryani. This is the ideal variety used. Wash it thoroughly. Let it soak for 15 minutes. Then in a hot pan, add 2 tablespoons of ghee.

audio_description: 80-90% of the rice will be cooked with the lid closed. The remaining will be cooked during dum. Make sure the vegetables don’t get overcooked. If there’s excess water in the pan, increase the flame and let it evaporate. Then, add half of the cooked rice to the pan.

audio_description: If you prepare the dum this way, you’ll get a tasty and fragrant vegetable biryani. Mix all ingredients well from the bottom. If you want smaller soya chunks, cut them in half and fry. Even though it’s a vegetable biryani, with Jeerakasala rice, it tastes as good as chicken biryani.
